prevention measures: Regular controlled burns, Creating firebreaks, Proper disposal of cigarettes and matches, Restrictions on open flames in vulnerable areas, Public awareness campaigns.
regions of impact: Areas with dense forests, especially during dry seasons, such as California, Australia, Amazon rainforest, Mediterranean regions.
emergency response: Evacuation of threatened areas, Mobilizing firefighting resources, Air drops of water and fire retardants.

environmental factors: Extended dry periods, High temperatures, Accumulation of dry fallen leaves and wood, Strong winds.

prevention measures: Be prepared with the following items: Fresh batteries and a battery-operated TV, radio, or internet-enabled device to listen to the latest emergency weather information. A tornado emergency plan including access to a safe shelter for yourself, your family, people with special needs, and your pets. An emergency kit (including water, non-perishable food, and medication). A list of important information, including telephone numbers.
regions of impact: Locations across the country, especially Tornado Alley in the USA which includes parts of Texas, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Nebraska.
emergency response: Stay aware of weather conditions, know the best places to shelter both indoors and outdoors, and always protect yourself from injury, especially your head.
safety equipment: Fresh batteries and a battery-operated TV, radio, or internet-enabled device to listen to the latest emergency weather information. An emergency kit (including water, non-perishable food, and medication). A helmet for head protection.
environmental factors: Tornadoes continue to impact locations across the country every year, bringing massive winds and destruction of properties in their paths.

prevention measures: Make a Plan, Secure properties with hurricane shutters, Trim trees and shrubs to make them more wind-resistant, Reinforce roofs, windows, and doors, including the garage doors.
regions of impact: North Pacific, Atlantic, Caribbean, Gulf of Mexico, Southeastern USA.
emergency response: Evacuation, Emergency supply kit, Emergency phone numbers, Shelter locations, Pet-friendly shelters, Staying informed with the latest weather updates.
safety equipment: Flashlights, Fire extinguisher, First aid kit, Batteries, Battery-operated or hand-cranked radio, Canned food and a manual can opener, Bottled water.
